answers.answer: Before you take another dose of Effexor, go to Google, type in "Effexor Withdrawl".  Are the withdrawls of getting off Effexor worth the benefits of taking it? ABSOLUTELY NOT!Now, go back to Google and type in "Natural Cures for Depression".If what I have been thru, trying to get off of this Evil drug, stops just 1 person from ever getting on it, then maybe it's been worth it.I wish I would have educated myself on what I was putting in my body, before I did it.

not sure how old you are but are you on b/c pills?  That could be the reason for multiple periods....if you are on b/c, you may need to switch.  I would definately call the doc on that.As far as the Effexor side effects go, the first week or two it really mellows you out and yes, you do sleep a little more, at least it affected me that way.  I am now on 75 milgrams and after a couple of weeks you settle into your old routine.  Effexor has worked great for me, especially with the racing thoughts and anxiety.

question: I just started on effexor 37.5 twice daily and I am so concerned about problems I am having. I have diabetes and depression and I have been reslly really tired lately and having hair loss and multiple periods each month.  The doctor thought it might be stress. I was given effexor. Since I started effexor, my fatigue has greatly increaed. I am really tired, just washed out, and stay in bed until 10 or 11 each morning. Is fatigue a side effect of effexor? Colud my fatigue be related to something else?
title: Effexor side effects
